channel.title: Best Method
channel.description: Hello, i was just wondeirng which would be the most best storage method? LIke Saving something to an XML file, or to a MySQL Database? Which one would be fastest, and use the least amount of memory?

item.title: Best Method
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/Properties.html

Perfect for basic storage. You can use it to store a String-element Map to a text file or to an XML file, whatever you want.

Read full topic

item.description:
@frank wrote:

check out where 99% of his posts are, that should give you a good idea

Read full topic

item.title: Best Method
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

Given that we are in a java section you technically could use serialization. The size would be big (probably could be reduced a lot by compression) but it would require the bare minimum in code and would be perfect for those lacking the understanding of a parser.

xml also has an issue with size but has the advantage of being human readable.

MySQL requires a database but there are many simple commands that can be used to manipulate the data easily. (although java could probably do the same with the burden of actually writing code).

Give us some context. Do you want it to be human readable? How important is size? Speed? How much coding experience do you have?

Read full topic

item.description:
